title: What tilts you the most?
body: I’d like to hear what tilts you guys the most when playing this game, personally for me it’s being camped by the enemy jungle in Laning phase

replies.body: When I have decent map-awareness, ping something rightfully (e.g. enemy missing, he is coming to you) and people still refuse to listen to it and usually die. Easy avoidable deaths but here we go.

Players who negatively and aggressively micro manage the actions, purchases, and every waking decision of an ally, usually professing that they main the champion their ally happens to be playing at the time.

and

Players who ban ally picks because it's likely going to be a loss if I don't dodge it because the match will boil down to an all chat blame fest.

Enemies never tilt me. Only allies.

Like when I die once in lane, so my support starts actively competing with me for cs. That is tilting af.

This right here.  I can't understand why people want to upset their teammates, and even more so when its me.  Sometimes something really stupid happens and we can all laugh about it, but often they are just being way too negative and it only further upsets things.
Playing mid lane and out of the sudden It turns into an ARAM game. I don't talk about late game, I mean ARAM at 10-15 minutes. The only thing that stops me from getting higher score...

Broooooo....  You beat me to it.  Its so much fun when im mid and work up a decent CS/exp advantage against my enemy midlaner, but then ~ 10 minutes- "enemy team has destroyed the first turret"  oh and now the enemy botlane and jg are all mid, and so is my botlane, messing up my CS and losing the skirmish b/c the enemy botlane is way more fed off turret plates and first turret.  AH nothing worse.  Everytime i feel like shouting WHY TF IS EVERYONE MID?!?!?!
riot and rewarding bad play because  ''comeback'' ''mEcHaNicZ''

> [{quoted}](name=adceazyas123,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qwHGjHm5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-04T20:58:59.177+0000)
>
> riot and rewarding bad play because  ''comeback'' ''mEcHaNicZ''

lol

People who come to my lane, die. Come again. Die again. Then proceed to flame me when I die to the now fed enemy and jg. 

It's not so much tilting as baffling. 

I tend to not tilt but laugh at how silly it is that someone is tilted

People who lack sportsmanship. Trash talks fine but being a shithead is not, there are some basic rules of etiquette that should be exhibited in all human interaction regardless of online or in person. Show a basic level of class.

A close second.

I also hate Self fulfilling prophecies where some one gives up and makes 0 effort on a winnable match... thus making the outcome exactly what they said it would be.

Example is some one who Lost lane by 2 kills so they don't try. "GG FF MOVE ON"  Then they spend rest of game in zero effort mode mindless splitting. wont contest objs, react to pings, ward.  Often times you see them over extend and feed. Others just play stupidly safe and refuse to participate  in team fights to prevent a Bad KDA and focus on Pad stats over a victory.

Many times you lose this game, but not significantly. To the point its very difficult to not blame the idiot who just stopped making any effort.

Thou.. Honestly its just a frusturation. I worked hard to make myself more tilt proof as a player so its rare that i ever get so irritated it impacts my performance in game and if i am upset i know to not que for a ranked match.

I made myself play http://kayin.moe/iwbtg/ To become better at dealing with frustration and getting better self awareness on when i hit "Tilted" to the point it impacts playing. Once your unable to beat  a screen you used to because of a later screen your tilted.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wzjuQ3K72u4 Getting over it is a good option as well and likely more pleasant of an experience ultimately then I wanna be the guy. But..... iwbtg is free which makes it a good tool for any player.

I'll put em in tiers. 1 is the bane of my League experience, 3 are mild problems that may or may not get to me depending on the situation.

TIER 1

- Mid inhitor down, Top and Bot free for the taking, team groups mid like it's ARAM, nothing is achieved.
- Baron secured, two inhibis down, all we need is one final push, Jungler goes farm Gromp.
- Bot/Mid inhibitor down, enemy has to deal with supers, Baron free to take, team goes wonder around enemy jungle for no reason.
- {{champion:81}}
- Riot Meddler
- One-Item Arms Race Meta
- The new NA lol esports site

TIER 2

- Supports acting like they're incapable of making mistakes that cost a lane. It's always the ADC's fault. They'll never accept they've messed up.
- Going 30 CS ahead in lane, enemy ADC gets a kill, my lead is gone.
- Exit lane 7 - 0, Mid fed so we lose anyway.
- Herald Takes 2 Towers.
- Tanks that deal damage.

TIER 3

- The new surrender box.
- The client.
- Lux Support (either side)
- Chat box impossible to disable. Gotta drag to a corner or make -99 size

I'd argue ADCs are the same way. I play both sides of bot (primary support secondary adc) so pretty much it's just "that second laner in general" with me at this point. Whether you get a support who literally hides behind your tier 2 turret so they don't get hit and tells you to stop feeding, an adc who got one early kill and decided to try a 2v4 everyone was pinging from miles away, or you get one or the other that just *can not fucking dodge*, it's always the other person's fault. It can never have anything to do with one laner playing poorly, it *has* to be the other guy, and it always inevitably makes it so that both fail equally.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qwHGjHm5,comment-id=00200000,timestamp=2019-06-05T00:44:14.616+0000)
>
> I'd argue ADCs are the same way. I play both sides of bot (primary support secondary adc) so pretty much it's just "that second laner in general" with me at this point. Whether you get a support who literally hides behind your tier 2 turret so they don't get hit and tells you to stop feeding, an adc who got one early kill and decided to try a 2v4 everyone was pinging from miles away, or you get one or the other that just *can not fucking dodge*, it's always the other person's fault. It can never have anything to do with one laner playing poorly, it *has* to be the other guy, and it always inevitably makes it so that both fail equally.

Yeah, for sure it's a two way thing, but the common culture is that Supps are never to blame and it's always an ADC overextending. It's never a Supp missing a critical skillshot on a snared target (Had a Pyke earlier today who couldn't land a Q on my Xayah snared targets...) or the Supp being too far ahead or too far behind. I'm all for both sides seeing their faults, but when have you seen a post anywhere where a Supp admits to mistakes? It's to the point that it has become a meme, where the Supp always babysits the AD and if the AD dies is their fault. I wish this changed, but I don't think it will.

That goes both ways too. In like seasons 2-5, the meme was reversed - that the supports were supposed to be spammy ward bots and the adc's personal butler/maid, but if the adc died, it was cause the support either 

- didn't ward
- didn't peel
- were overextended/hiding under tier 2 tower
- didn't sacrifice themselves for the cause
- didn't ping *another lane's mia* in time
- cant fucking dodge
- stealing (literally 3) cs (in a 37 minute game)
- or any combination of the above.

Now in like seasons 6-current, it's the other way around. Now the adcs are either

- too far overextended/hiding under tower
- deal less damage than scuttle
- aren't focusing the right target (trick question - the right target is always the target they weren't hitting)
- can't cs for shit
- cant fucking dodge
- have no map awareness (since at this point pings are also a meme)
- or any combination of the above.

Note: a lot of the times the complaints on both sides are actually somewhat accurate in most cases. But the issue comes in neither one ever being able to accept it. And as I said, it's to the point it really doesn't matter, since the resulting flame war means neither of them are going to be relevant. I say this about myself too - the adcs who hide under tower are my biggest pet peeve since it means we're generating zero lane pressure and losing exp to the freeze. So when I tilt from that and the adc starts flaming me back for "ruining his cs" that he literally refuses to contest, our lane is pretty much done.

But on a positive note - if it can change that much once, it can do so again, so your rather fruitless wish for the supports to sit down may still come to fruition.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qwHGjHm5,comment-id=0020000000000000,timestamp=2019-06-05T01:47:17.071+0000)

> - or any combination of the above.
> 
> Note: a lot of the times the complaints on both sides are actually somewhat accurate in most cases. But the issue comes in neither one ever being able to accept it. And as I said, it's to the point it really doesn't matter, since the resulting flame war means neither of them are going to be relevant. I say this about myself too - the adcs who hide under tower are my biggest pet peeve since it means we're generating zero lane pressure and losing exp to the freeze. So when I tilt from that and the adc starts flaming me back for "ruining his cs" that he literally refuses to contest, our lane is pretty much done.
> 
> But on a positive note - if it can change that much once, it can do so again, so your rather fruitless wish for the supports to sit down may still come to fruition.

I don't want it to be a world where the Supps get blamed for everything. This is gonna sound really weird but just in like a successful marriage or a really bad divorce, it's always a dance of two. I just want people to take responsibility for their mistakes. If I'm way too extended and die, that's my fault. If Pyke can't land a Q on a snared target, then walks up to them and dies, that's on him. I also put it in Tier 2 cause it's nowhere near as bad as my Tier 1 stuff.

Playing support or AD and suddenly being oneshot under my tower by a 6/0 {{champion:238}} /{{champion:91}}/ {{champion:105}}/ {{champion:7}}/ {{champion:84}} /{{champion:107}}/ {{champion:56}}/ {{champion:120}}

When I play engage support like Naut, Leona, Alistar and my ADC gets poked non stop, dies and blames me for that.

Like they can't dodge anything, but it's my fault even though I have no shields, heals or anything to repel damage.

.... Also playing against Ezreal or Vayne xD
When I either just back or die, enemy roams, but as soon as I get back to catch the wave "wtf why no follow"
Failing to last hit a cannon minion.

1. People saying "ff 15" when were are barely 1500 gold behind and playing lategame beasts.
2. When my jungler doesnt aknowledge that i'm veigar, decides to gank despite my "back off" pings then the two outcomes are :
- I lose a lot of farm and xp (best outcome)
- The ennemy jungler is here he/we die or waste summoner as we are 1.5 vs 2 since a level 2 veigar has no damages.

Barely losing a ranked game because ADC decided it was impossible for the enemy to win and running it down mid 6 times and then going afk so you have to build ad juggernaut Leona and basically 1v8 with all odds against you because of your 3-year-old ADC who decided to ruin everything.
When a bad player misplays and chalks up another death to jg difference.
{{champion:157}}

Having to type my lane in blind pick only to have someone beat me by milliseconds then trying to pick another lane to get beat out again.  They need to add role selection to Blind Pick.  And to those that say "Just play draft", you don't understand what draft is.  Draft is for bans and seeing what the enemy is picking to try and counterpick it.  Draft was never about lane selection.  Lane selection was a quality of life fix they added to ranked play.  There is no reason that after almost a decade we still have the call system for blind pick.

> [{quoted}](name=PeaceLoveTHC,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qwHGjHm5,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-06-04T21:56:15.106+0000)
>
> Having to type my lane in blind pick only to have someone beat me by milliseconds then trying to pick another lane to get beat out again.  They need to add role selection to Blind Pick.  And to those that say "Just play draft", you don't understand what draft is.  Draft is for bans and seeing what the enemy is picking to try and counterpick it.  Draft was never about lane selection.  Lane selection was a quality of life fix they added to ranked play.  There is no reason that after almost a decade we still have the call system for blind pick.

agreed
the lvl 13 yi that I somehow got matchmade with telling me to "stop feeding". Pssh, what else should a yas do?

Troll/Low Elo supports who are somehow post-30 and have no inkling of how to play the role.  Got one just this weekend.  Literally went Lux and took {{item:1056}} as a starting item.  You have no idea how tilting that is.  As an ADC, it completely robs you of any agency in the game, and 90% of the time, somehow, it's the ADCs fault.  

(And if you're an ADC main who gets autofilled and pulls this shit, fuck you.  Other roles might have the ignorance excuse, but you of all people should know what makes a good support, and you should take it as a challenge to outdo all the supports who ever fucked you over in the bot lane when you get autofilled.  Next time I do, I'm going to record my game and post it on here to show everyone how support ought to be played.  Just imagine your ideal support in the bot lane, and do everything you'd want him or her to do for you and for the team.  It isn't rocket science, people.)
Ppl who says "ez" at the end, no matter if it's from my team or the enemy team

The matchmaking system.

I rarely get even games where both sides are of equal skill level, it's almost always a one-sided victory or loss. I'm commonly matched up against premades, funnel comps, and people that generally just know what they're doing (and work together to win the game), while my teammates will rarely watch the map, not know how to play their champions and fight amongst one another. The alternative is when the roles are reversed, with the enemy team int'ing and/or complaining in /all chat. I'm not really sure what can be done about this, but it really sucks the fun out of the game.
Somebody hitting a ward when I placed a Control ward to block the vision but you hit it and decide to make it known your there while doing Drake/Baron.

Most people don't know about that mechanic. I myself only learned of it while watching [Fiona](https://www.twitch.tv/yathatwasabanana)'s stream while she was giving some general support tips while smurfing and stomping the shit out of Silvers on Lux support.
I absolutely hate feeders more than anything in the entire game. I absolutely hate to be in a lane hearing "an ally has been slain" every 30 seconds. There is nothing I hate more about this game.
When people who are toxic as hell win
Junglers who play {{champion:60}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:141}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:421}} and proceed to AFK farm.

When the jungler doesn't realize what his role is. The reply that tilts me is "it's not my job to win your lane for you" meanwhile they haven't even attempted to gank the enemy with them overextended hitting my tower.
playing the game in its current state and remembering that it actually used to be a good game.
being bursted down before im able to react

In game:
1. When my team think that they are superior to me whenever I just lost lane, but they almost lost lanes too and aren't much better than me.
2. People just plays only meta picks, kaisa/vayne/jinx/pyke/vladimir for example, I meet them almost everygame. Honestly there are tons of picks that are comparable to them, but people just plays them because some website says so they will play them. It made the game boring as hell 0 creativity. Few champions are broken and needs nerf in meta but, not everyone, I don't know why these less broken  are so popular, just follow the sheeps syndrome.
3. Bot and jungle have way more impact early than top and mid in winning games.
4. Yeah I hate when someone dies 5 times in first 10 mins of the game with 0 kills.
5. Toxic 10 years old kiddos.

Out of game:
6. Too many information websites, tells u how enemy is playing etc
7. Not nerfed, changed{{item:3161}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3152}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:555}}{{champion:157}} {{champion:67}}  Conqueror not deleted from the game, or changed.
8. Feels like riot don't listen the players and just focus on pro leagues, unless players rant about something for half a year.
9. This forum still rant about riven, while they don't see problem with other champions xD,
10,{{champion:77}} His kit is old af but it's working, His visual upgrade is ultimate skin, visuals not changed since years.
11.{{champion:63}} {{champion:143}} not changed into midlaners since years.
12. {{champion:4}} {{champion:35}} give them some love, Tf is too much team dependant, while shaco can't be played by simple humans, he is comparably weak to other assassins.

I could write 5x more but for what xd

Being told to 'follow my laner' as an immobile by comparison champ.

Yeah sure.. I'll hop over the fucking walls after {{champion:91}} as a fucking {{champion:45}}. While I'm at it I'll just leap my ass down to bot lane after {{champion:98}} while my {{summoner:12}} is on cooldown.

{{champion:35}} and {{champion:555}}  

They both feel to me that they can do countless mistakes and not be punished for it. It's frustrating.
Reworks

My opponents shit-talking unironically after playing like a pansy for 10 minutes, flashing out at ~20hp and then calling it an outplay. 

Also people who use the "?" ping for anything other than notifying me as to when a laner/jungler is gone. Seriously, that ping is soooo toxic right now, and it's a one way ticket for either a mute or a report depending on how obnoxious you are. 
Use the pings for what they're meant to be used for :)
Being 5 minutes into the game and then some moron dies and already calls "ggwp" and starts spaming ff votes at 15 minutes.

Seeing the BM-ping "Enemy Missing" being spammed whenever anyone makes a mistake. It's just so unhelpful in every single way. And constant surrender votes from the same person.

Flamers I can handle - they only provide the entertainment. Trolls and feeders only makes me accept the defeat and take the rest of the game as an increased challenge.

Also, Shaco in general. I hate his face, his kit, seeing him, playing against him, playing as him, knowing that he exists at all.

Your team just refusing to co op with each other. 
>Grouping? nah that shits for r%%%%%s, even with baron everyone just splits and does there own thing, gets caught out and dies
>Playing safe when behind? Fuck no go in every time im in lane and fuck everyone telling me to play safe
>0 objective control/coordination
>0 team work just me me me me me

FFS people get your heads out of your ass, put your petty ego's aside and work together to win. This is a TEAM game
When I am playing well but cannot actually even help to decide if I win or no, because I am a top laner, and the games is about bott and jungle.

People who ban none, then proceed to complain about how busted a champ is in game
{{sticker:sg-shisa}}
Singed being in a bad place for the last 5 years. after tons of ninja nerfs to items and people not likeing his gameplay style his early game is a joke

When my adc decides to go in when all of my cc or enchanting abilities are on cd and they blame me for just autoing  
{{sticker:leblanc-funny}}
or when I go in and my adc decides to play farming simulator instead
(if you are going to do this at least get all of the cs ty)
When you're destroying a control ward and an ally decides to last hit it when you did 3/4 of the hits
When you fat finger R instead of E as {{champion:40}}  and wonder how you got m6 in the first place
When mid doesn't ping MIA and enemy mid is a {{champion:238}} or{{champion:55}} 
Pretty much when adc flames support for their mistakes.

"Karma you're so useless oh my goodness its a jungle trist can you not shield me" -Ashe when I was 1 hit away from dying
